Cannot debug runtime errors or performance issues in live applications

best_practices: Always use Server Components by default and only add 'use client' directive when you need browser APIs, event handlers, or React hooks
Implement Suspense boundaries around async components to enable streaming and improve perceived performance with loading skeletons
Add generateMetadata to all dynamic routes for proper SEO and social media sharing capabilities
anti_patterns: Using 'use client' at the top level of every component defeats the performance benefits of Server Components
Fetching data with useEffect in Server Components when you can use async/await directly in the component body
Creating API routes for every data operation when Server Actions provide a simpler pattern for form submissions and mutations

faq.question: When should I use Server Components vs Client Components?
faq.answer: Use Server Components by default for data fetching and static content. Only use Client Components when you need browser APIs, event handlers, React hooks, or state management.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication in App Router?
faq.answer: Use middleware.ts to protect routes at the edge, check session in Server Components before rendering, and redirect unauthorized users with the redirect function from next/navigation.

faq.question: What is the difference between layout.tsx and template.tsx?
faq.answer: Layouts persist across navigation and maintain state, while templates re-execute on every navigation. Use layouts for shared UI and templates when you need fresh state on each page change.

faq.question: How do I optimize images in Next.js App Router?
faq.answer: Use the next/image Image component with width, height, and alt props. Set priority true for above-fold images and use appropriate sizes for responsive images.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with JavaScript instead of TypeScript?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns work with JavaScript. Simply remove type annotations from the code templates. However, TypeScript is recommended for better developer experience and error detection.

faq.question: How do I handle forms with Server Actions?
faq.answer: Create a server action file with 'use server' directive, export async functions that accept FormData, and reference them in the form action prop. Server Actions automatically handle serialization and revalidation.
